popt4jlib

Class ReentrantSocketEvalFunctionBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.ReentrantSocketEvalFunctionBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FunctionIntf

    public class ReentrantSocketEvalFunctionBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    The class is a wrapper for functions that are computed in a different process and communicate with the optimizer through sockets. The process that evaluates the function must receive its arguments via a socket in a known host/port address, and will return the double value of the evaluation back to the popt4jlib client through the same socket. The class also keeps track of how many times a function has been evaluated, plus it forces threads asking for function evaluation to execute sequentially.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReentrantSocketEvalFunctionBase(java.lang.String host, int port)
      public constructor, setting up the evaluation count to zero.
      ReentrantSocketEvalFunctionBase(java.lang.String host, int port, boolean sendFunctionParams)
      same as two-arg constructor, but also specifies whether to send function params (in the Hashtable, not the argument of the function) or not via the socket.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double eval(java.lang.Object arg, java.util.Hashtable params)
      force function to be reentrant as no two threads can enter the eval() method simultaneously
      long getEvalCount()
      get the total number of times the eval(arg,params) method was called so far.
      void shutDownSocket()
      shut-down the associated socket.
